body:
### Problem

the `col` of cursor position is wrong:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0a5add20-fd40-49e9-8b97-c07248fdabad

### Steps to reproduce

1. minimal.lua

```lua
vim.o.virtualedit = "all"



vim.api.nvim_create_augroup("test", {clear = true})

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd(
	{
		"ModeChanged",
	},
	{
		group = "test",
		pattern = "n:*",
		callback = function()
			vim.o.virtualedit = "onemore"
		end,
	}
)

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd(
	{
		"ModeChanged",
	},
	{
		group = "test",
		pattern = "*:n",
		callback = function()
			vim.o.virtualedit = "all"
		end,
	}
)

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd(
	{
		"ModeChanged",
	},
	{
		group = "test",
		pattern = "i:*",
		callback = function()
			local pos = vim.fn.getpos("'^")
			table.remove(pos, 1)
			vim.fn.cursor(pos)
		end,
	}
)

-- vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd(
-- 	{
-- 		"ModeChanged",
-- 	},
-- 	{
-- 		group = "test",
-- 		pattern = "i:*",
-- 		callback = function()
-- 			vim.cmd("normal! `^")
-- 		end,
-- 	}
-- )
```

2. `nvim --clean -u minimal.lua`
3. press `cc` `lkj` `<esc>`
4. the statusline shows `3-4`, but should be `4` (since both `col` and `virtcol` are `4`) 
5. press `/<esc>`, the statusline shows `4`, which is correct

note:

If the third autocmd is replaced with the commented code, then in this case (`cc{text}<Esc>`) it won’t take effect, and I don’t know why

### Expected behavior

the `col` of cursor should be `4`

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.12.0-dev-1030+ge4d3812c8b

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

yes, vim 9.1

### Operating system/version

6.16.0-arch2-1

### Terminal name/version

st 0.8.5

### $TERM environment variable

st-256color

### Installation

build form repo
title: wrong cursor position using modechanged autocmd with virtualedit
